intro: Stigmatosema cochabambae, commonly known as the Cochabamba stigmate, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
